Definition1: - (British) the use of archaisms (as in a historical novel)
example1: Several other stories and verses that they jointly contributed to magazines are historical and melodramatic in tone, larded with archaic oaths and exclamations and general gadzookery.  Julia Briggs, A Woman of Passion- The Life of E. Nesbit, 1987
example2: Her spare prose and dialogue give a period flavour without the dread excesses of gadzookery.  David Langford, The Complete Critical Assembly, 2002
